required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 24-hour Urine Collection Feasibility Study, 2013
clinical_study.official_title: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey 24-Hour Urine Collection Feasibility Study, 2013

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: A 24-hour urine pilot study was conducted as part of the 2013 NHANES to test the feasibility of implementing a 24-hour urine collection as part of NHANES in 2014.

detailed_description.textblock:
The 24-hour urine pilot study was conducted March - June 2013 in three NHANES locations. A random half-sample of non-pregnant US adults, aged 20-69 who were examined in the NHANES mobile examination center were selected. Participants received instructions, started and ended the urine collection in a urine study mobile examination center (UMEC), and answered questions about collection. A random half of participants who collected a complete 24-h urine were asked to collect a second 24-h urine. Urinary sodium, potassium, chloride, and creatinine excretion were analyzed.
Participation rates in two other post-examination components, the Physical Activity Monitor and the Dietary Recall, were monitored to determine whether collecting a 24-hour urine had an effect on response rates for the two components.

primary_outcome.description: Completion rate of initial 24-hour urine collection.
Completion rate of second 24-hour urine collection

secondary_outcome.measure: Response rates for the Physical Activity Monitor
secondary_outcome.description: Response rates for the Physical Activity Monitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Response rates for the Phone Follow-up Dietary Recall
secondary_outcome.description: Response rates for the Phone Follow-up Dietary Recall.

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine volume for the initial urine collection
secondary_outcome.description: Urine volume adjusted to 24 hours, initial urine collection

secondary_outcome.measure: Urine volume for the second urine collection
secondary_outcome.description: Urine volume adjusted to 24 hours, second urine collection

secondary_outcome.measure: Urinary sodium excretion for the initial urine collection
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour urinary sodium excretion, initial urine collection

secondary_outcome.measure: Urinary sodium excretion for the second urine collection
secondary_outcome.description: 24-hour urinary sodium excretion, second urine collection

intervention.description: A random half sample of NHANES participants 20-69 examined in the mobile examination center were asked to collect a 24-hour urine specimen.

study_pop.textblock: NHANES participants aged 20-69 years who were examined in the mobile examination center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 20-69 year old adults examined in the NHANES mobile examination center
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant, unable to respond for themselves

overall_official.affiliation: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, National Center for Health Statistics, Division of Health and Nutrition Examination Surveys

facility.name: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey

patient_data.ipd_description: The NHANES 24-hour urine pilot study data set can be made available through the National Center for Health Statistics Research Data Center by submitting a research proposal at http://www.cdc.gov/rdc/.
